summary: Federal statistical data is used to calculate funding to states, to understand economic issues and population changes, and more. This data is primarily maintained across 16 agencies and units and over 100 statistical programs, operating in coordination as "the federal statistical system." During our August 2024 forum, experts identified challenges with the system—including in data privacy, quality, and accuracy, and meeting users' data needs. They...
title: Highlights of a Forum: Expert Views on the Federal Statistical System
